# The Career Block - Blueprint

## About blueprint
The Career Block blueprint is a ready-to-implement initiative to connect your startup society / pop-up city with local schools. It's a high-impact, replicable, and relatively low-effort way to give back to the community - and help students find direction in their careers early in life. This blueprint provides a framework that you can adapt to your specific context and resources. The core idea is to leverage the diverse talent within your startup society to create a memorable and valuable experience for students.

[view this bluprint in action in career block 00](https://moments.poap.xyz/drops/185571)

## The Career Block - Event overview
The Career Block is a dynamic and engaging event designed to expose students (primarily in grades 9-12 / age 14 - 17) to a wide array of career possibilities. The event centers around a series of lightning talks (typically 10 minutes each) delivered by professionals from diverse fields within the community. This fast-paced format allows for maximum exposure to different career paths while keeping the audience engaged in your block of time.

### Project Needs
-   **Block initiators:** 1-3 individuals from the community to lead and manage the event.
-   **School Liaison:** Secure interest, confirmed date, time, and venue (auditorium preferred) from a local school. Resources:
	- [School Pitch Template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AtpOXAB3GjzfMCFYuMFqyguFEnSBvKIZJEJds4m8V0U/edit?usp=sharing).
-   **Speaker curation:**: Curate ~12 speakers from the community. Optimize speaker selection based on the diversity of profession / industry. Resources:
	- [Speaker Management sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wLyNVHQS9t_ANhuj9MU5IyEC5mTS0CCNaTlQn24PJXM/edit?usp=sharing)
 	- [Speaker Interest Form form template](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1180Av4olAU7KJco1NMN4hED5VfPYXuA6sw0AinuOHVs/edit)
-   **Host:** Decide on who hosts the event
-   **Event Logistics**
	-   **Venue:** Coordinate room setup and AV with the school.
	-   **Refreshments:** Arrange refreshments for the networking session (can be arranged by school, if they agree, or self-organize / crowdsource)
	-   **Communication:** Use a group chat (Whatsapp / Telegram) between speakers and hosts to coordinate the details
	-   **Event day coordination:** Ensure everyone involved is communicated and aligned on the meeting point, venue location, and travel arrangement (can be self organized)
    -   **Proof of Attendance:** Create and distribute POAPs to everyone involved - speakers + students + organizers. Artwork templates tbd
    -	**Announcements:** [artwork template](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/4807184/413229985-50d17786-ca49-4310-bffa-0a9f6a642ca9.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..tVigWE7SWSUNBPdJQcwsrPzcsJJBBw7wyICRz9t2DI0)
    -   **Video content:** tbd
    -   **Post-Event:** tbd
    

### Event structure:

-   **Lightning Talks (90 minutes):** ~12 speakers deliver 10-minute presentations on their careers, and short QnA time per speaker.
-   **Networking & Refreshments (60 minutes):** Informal interaction between students and speakers to dive deeper into each projects.
    

### Session Content:
Each 10-minute presentation will provide a concise overview of the speaker's career journey and current role, including:
-   **Career Snapshot:** A brief introduction to their professional background and current position.
-   **Industry Insights:** A glimpse into the industry they work in and its impact on the world.
-   **Day-to-day in the role:** A snapshot of their typical tasks and responsibilities.
-   **Advice for aspiring professionals:** Guidance on the skills and knowledge students should focus on to pursue a similar career.
